ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.1.1_0: Homage to that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.1.2_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.1.3_0: At that time the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka were quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha. They approached other monks who were also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and said to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.1.9_0: Because of that, new quarrels started and existing quarrels became worse.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.1_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.2_0: “How can the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka act like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.8_0: and in this way start new quarrels and make existing quarrels worse?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.10_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.11_0: “Is it true that the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are acting like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.17_0: and in this way start new quarrels and make existing quarrels worse?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.20_0: “It’s not suitable, monks, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.21_0: “... How can those foolish men act like this?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.22_0: Legal issues in the Sangha and also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.23_0: They went to see her and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.29_0: so that new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.30_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it or increase the confidence of those who have it,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.31_0: but it will hinder confidence in those without it, and it will cause some with confidence to change their minds.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.3.1_0: Then the Buddha spoke in many ways in dispraise of being difficult to support and maintain, in dispraise of great desires, discontent, socializing, and laziness; but he spoke in many ways in praise of being easy to support and maintain, of fewness of wishes, contentment, self-elimination, ascetic practices, serenity, reduction in things, and of being energetic. After giving a teaching on what is right and proper, he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.3.2_0: “Well then, monks, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.1_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.2_0: First you should accuse the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka. They should then be reminded of what they have done, before they are charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.3_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.4_0: These monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha. They go to other monks who are also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and they say to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.10_0: so that new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.11_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.13_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.14_0: These monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of others.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.16_0: And the other monks who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha went to those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.22_0: so that new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.23_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.24_0: Any monk who approves of doing this procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.25_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.26_0: For the second time I speak on this matter:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.27_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.28_0: These monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of others.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.30_0: And the other monks who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha went to those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.36_0: so that new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.37_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.38_0: Any monk who approves of doing this procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.39_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.40_0: A third time I speak on this matter:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.41_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.42_0: These monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of others.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.44_0: And the other monks who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha went to those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.50_0: so that new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.51_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.52_0: Any monk who approves of doing this procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.53_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.54_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.55_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.0_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.1_0: “Monks, when a legal procedure of condemnation has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.2_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.3_0: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.4_0: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.5_0: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed any offense that is clearable by confession,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.6_0: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.7_0: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.8_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.9_0: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.10_0: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.11_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.12_0: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”

ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.0_0: The group of six on wishing
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.1_0: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of condemnation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.2_0: They are quarrelsome and argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.3_0: he is ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.4_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.5_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.6_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.7_0: He has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view; he’s failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.8_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.9_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.10_0: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.11_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.1_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.2_0: one who is quarrelsome and argumentative, one who creates legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.3_0: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether they have has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.4_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.5_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against these three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.6_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against another three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.7_0: those who have failed in the higher morality; those who have failed in the higher conduct; those who have failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.8_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against these three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.9_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against another three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.10_0: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.11_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against these three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.12_0: The group of six on wishing is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.1_0: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of condemnation done against himself should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.3_0: You shouldn’t give the full ordination
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.4_0: if formal support is not given;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.6_0: He should not consent to an instructor of nuns;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.7_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.8_0: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.9_0: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.10_0: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.11_0: You shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.12_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.13_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.14_0: A nun should not cancel the invitation procedure of a monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.15_0: You shouldn’t make a choice to do
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.16_0: A nun should not make accusations against a monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.17_0: A nun should not ask a monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.18_0: He should not accuse a monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.19_0: A nun should not remind a monk of an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.20_0: He should not associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.21_0: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of condemnation are finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.1.1_0: When the Sangha had done a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.1.2_0: they conducted themselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. They then went to the monks
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.1.3_0: and told them about this, adding, “What should we do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.1.4_0: who in turn told the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.1.6_0: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.1_0: When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of condemnation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.2_0: They give full ordination to a novice monk who has been given dependence, and who agrees to use a novice monk, and who has been appointed as instructor of nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.3_0: These are the five qualities to be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.5_0: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.6_0: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.7_0: These are the five qualities to be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.8_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.9_0: he cancels the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation of a regular monk; he accuses him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.10_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.11_0: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of condemnation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.2_0: They don’t give dependence to formal support, nor do they consent to a novice monk attend on him. They being appointed as instructor of nuns, and if he instructs about the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.3_0: These are the five qualities that should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.5_0: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.6_0: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.7_0: These are the five qualities that should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.8_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.9_0: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation of a regular monk; he doesn’t make amends for permission; he doesn’t accuse monks; he doesn’t remind about offenses; he doesn’t make a regular monk forgot to preparation:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.10_0: These are the eight qualities that should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.11_0: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.1.1_0: “And, monks, this is how it should be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.1.2_0: After approaching the Sangha, the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should put their upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on their heels, raise their joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.1.3_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against us, but we have conducted ourselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. We ask for the legal procedure of condemnation to be lifted.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.1.4_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.1.5_0: And they should ask a third time.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.1.6_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.1_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.2_0: When the Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against them, they conducted themselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and they ask for the legal procedure of condemnation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.3_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.5_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.6_0: When the Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against them, they conducted themselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and they ask for the legal procedure of condemnation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.7_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.8_0: Any monk who approves of doing this procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.9_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.10_0: For the second time I speak on this matter:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.11_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.12_0: When the Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against them, they conducted themselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and they ask for the legal procedure of condemnation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.13_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.14_0: Any monk who approves of doing this procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.15_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.16_0: A third time I speak on this matter:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.17_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.18_0: When the Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against them, they conducted themselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and they ask for the legal procedure of condemnation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.19_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.20_0: Any monk who approves of doing this procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.21_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.22_0: The Sangha has lifted the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.23_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.24_0: The first section on the legal procedure of condemnation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.1_0: At that time Venerable Seyyasaka was ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and incapable of determining whether he had committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.2_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.3_0: Moreover, the monks regularly gave him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.4_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.5_0: “How can Venerable Seyyasaka go on like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.6_0: How can he constantly and improperly socialize with householders?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.7_0: Moreover, the monks regularly gave him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.9_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.10_0: “Is it true that the monk Seyyasaka goes on like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.11_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.12_0: Moreover, how can it be that the monks regularly give him probation, send him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitate him?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.15_0: “It’s not suitable for that foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.16_0: How can he be ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.17_0: How can he constantly and improperly socialize with householders?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.18_0: Moreover, the monks regularly gave him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.19_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.21_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.22_0: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.1_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.2_0: First you should accuse the monk Seyyasaka. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he is charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.3_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.4_0: but he has ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.5_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.6_0: Moreover, the monks regularly gave him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.7_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.10_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.11_0: but he has ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.12_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.13_0: Moreover, the monks regularly gave him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.14_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.16_0: Any monk who approves of doing this procedure
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.18_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.19_0: For the second time I speak on this matter: ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.20_0: A third time I speak on this matter:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.21_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.22_0: but he has ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.23_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.24_0: Moreover, the monks regularly gave him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.25_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.27_0: Any monk who approves of doing this procedure
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.29_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.30_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.32_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.0_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.1_0: “When a legal procedure of demotion has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.2_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.3_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.4_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.5_0: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed any offense that is clearable by confession,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.6_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.7_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.8_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.9_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.10_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.11_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.12_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.13_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.14_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without questioning the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.15_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.16_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.17_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without the admission of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.18_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.19_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.20_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.21_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.22_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.23_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.24_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.25_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.26_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has confessed their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.27_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.28_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.29_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.30_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.31_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.32_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.33_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.34_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.35_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.36_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.37_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of ejection is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.38.0_0: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.38.1_0: “When a legal procedure of demotion has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.39_0: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done with the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.40_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.41_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.42_0: When it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.43_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.44_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.45_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done after having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.46_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.47_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.48_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.49_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...

ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.52_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...

ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.55_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.56_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.57_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.58_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.59_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.60_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.61_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.62_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.63_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.64_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.65_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.66_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.67_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.68_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of further penalty against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.69_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.70_0: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.71_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.72_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.73_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.74_0: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.75.0_0: The group of six on wishing
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.75.1_0: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of demotion against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.76_0: They are quarrelsome and argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.77_0: he is ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.78_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.79_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.80_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.81_0: He has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view; he’s failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.82_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.83_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.84_0: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.85_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.86_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.87_0: one who is quarrelsome and argumentative, one who creates legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.88_0: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether they have committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.89_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.90_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against these three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.91_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against another three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.92_0: those who have failed in the higher morality; those who have failed in the higher conduct; those who have failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.93_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against these three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.94_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against another three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.95_0: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.96_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against these three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.97_0: The group of six on wishing is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.98.1_0: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of demotion done against himself should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.100_0: You shouldn’t give the full ordination
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.101_0: if formal support is not given;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.103_0: He should not consent to an instructor of nuns;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.104_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.105_0: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.106_0: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.107_0: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.108_0: You shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.109_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.110_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.111_0: A nun should not cancel the invitation procedure of a monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.112_0: You shouldn’t make a choice to do
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.113_0: A nun should not make accusations against a monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.114_0: He should not ask a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.115_0: He should not accuse a monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.116_0: A nun should not remind a monk of an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.117_0: He should not associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.118_0: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of demotion are finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.1.1_0: Soon the Sangha did a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.1.3_0: Then, by associating with good friends, by having them recite, and by questioning them, he became learned and a master of the tradition; he became an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the summaries; he became knowledgeable and competent, had a sense of conscience, and was afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.1.4_0: And he conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. He then went to the monks
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.1.6_0: So what should I do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.1.7_0: who in turn told the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.1.9_0: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.2_0: They give full ordination to a novice monk who has been given dependence, and who agrees to use a novice monk, and who has been appointed as instructor of nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.3_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.5_0: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.6_0: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.7_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.8_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.9_0: he cancels the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation of a regular monk; he accuses him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.10_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.11_0: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.12.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.13_0: They don’t give dependence to formal support, nor do they consent to a novice monk attend on him. They being appointed as instructor of nuns, and if he instructs about the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.14_0: These are the five qualities that should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.15_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.16_0: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.17_0: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.18_0: These are the five qualities that should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.19_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.20_0: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation of a regular monk; he doesn’t make amends for permission; he doesn’t accuse monks; he doesn’t remind about offenses; he doesn’t make a regular monk forgot to preparation:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.21_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.22_0: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.1.1_0: “And, monks, this is how it should be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.1.2_0: After approaching the Sangha, the monk Seyyasaka should put his upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.1.3_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against me, but I have conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. I ask for the legal procedure of demotion to be lifted.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.1.4_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.1.5_0: And they should ask a third time.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.1_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.2_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.3_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka, but he has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.4_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift the legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.6_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.7_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka, but he has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.8_0: The Sangha lifts legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.9_0: Any monk who approves of lifting Seyyasaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.10_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.11_0: For the second time I speak on this matter:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.12_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.13_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka, but he has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.14_0: The Sangha lifts legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.15_0: Any monk who approves of lifting Seyyasaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.16_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.17_0: A third time I speak on this matter:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.18_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.19_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka, but he has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.20_0: The Sangha lifts legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.21_0: Any monk who approves of lifting Seyyasaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.22_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.23_0: The Sangha has lifted the legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.24_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.25_0: The second section on the legal procedure of demotion is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.1_0: At that time Assaji and Punabbasuka were the resident monks at Kīṭāgiri. They were bad and shameless,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.2_0: They were misbehaving in this way:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.3_0: They plant flowering trees, water them ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.4_0: They then took these things, or sent them, to the women, the daughters, the girls, the daughter-in-laws, and the female slaves of good families.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.5_0: They ate from the same plates as these women and drank from the same vessels. They sat on the same seats as them, and they lay down on the same beds, on the same sheets, under the same covers, both on the same sheets and under the same covers. They ate at the wrong time, drank alcohol, and wore garlands, perfumes, and cosmetics. They danced, sang, played instruments, and performed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.6_0: While the women were dancing, singing, playing instruments, and performing, so would they.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.7_0: While the villages were dancing, singing, playing instruments, and performing, so would they.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.1_0: They played various games: board games with eight and ten rows, imaginary board games, hopscotch, spillikins, dice games, tip-cat, painting-with-the-hand games, ball games, toy-pipe games, toy-plow games, turning somersaults, toy-windmill games, toy-measure games, toy-carriage games, toy-bow games, letter-guessing games, thought-guessing games, games of mimicking deformities.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.2_0: They trained in elephant riding, in horsemanship, in carriage riding, in archery, in swordsmanship.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.3_0: And they ran in front of elephants, horses, and carriages, and they ran backwards and forwards.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.4_0: They whistled, clapped their hands, wrestled, and boxed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.5_0: They spread their outer robes on a stage and said to the dancing girls,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.8_0: And they misbehave in a variety of ways.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.1_0: Just then a certain monk who had completed the rains residence in Kāsī was on his way to visit the Buddha at Sāvatthī when he arrived at Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.2_0: In the morning he robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Kīṭāgiri to collect almsfood. He was pleasing in the way he entered and returned, in looking at and in looking away, in bending and stretching out his arms; his eyes were lowered, and he was perfect in deportment.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.3_0: When people saw him, they said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.4_0: “Who is this, acting like a fool, like a dullard, continuously frowning?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.5_0: Who will give almsfood to him?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.6_0: Almsfood should instead be given to our Venerables Assaji and Punabbasuka, for they are gentle, congenial, pleasant to speak with, greeting one with a smile, welcoming, friendly, open, the first to speak.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.7_0: They are to be given alms.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.8_0: A certain lay follower saw that monk walking for alms in Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.9_0: He approached him, bowed, and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.1_0: The lay follower returned to the house and said to that monk,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.2_0: they asked for where they went.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.3_0: “I’ll go to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.4_0: “Well then, would you please pay respect at the feet of the Buddha in my name and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.5_0: ‘Venerable Sir, the monastery in Kīṭāgiri has been corrupted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.6_0: Assaji and Punabbasuka are the resident monks there. They are bad and shameless,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.7_0: They were misbehaving in this way:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.8_0: They plant flowering trees, water them ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.9_0: They then took these things, or sent them, to the women, the daughters, the girls, the daughter-in-laws, and the female slaves of good families.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.10_0: They ate from the same plates as these women and drank from the same vessels. They sat on the same seats as them, and they lay down on the same beds, on the same sheets, under the same covers, both on the same sheets and under the same covers. They ate at the wrong time, drank alcohol, and wore garlands, perfumes, and cosmetics. They danced, sang, played instruments, and performed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.11_0: While the women were dancing, singing, playing instruments, and performing,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.12_0: (All should be treated the same way.)
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.14_0: They played various games: board games with eight and ten rows, imaginary board games, hopscotch, spillikins, dice games, tip-cat, painting-with-the-hand games, ball games, toy-pipe games, toy-plow games, turning somersaults, toy-windmill games, toy-measure games, toy-carriage games, toy-bow games, letter-guessing games, thought-guessing games, games of mimicking deformities.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.15_0: They trained in elephant riding, in horsemanship, in carriage riding, in archery, in swordsmanship.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.16_0: And they ran in front of elephants, horses, and carriages, and they ran backwards and forwards.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.17_0: They whistled, clapped their hands, wrestled, and boxed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.18_0: They spread their outer robes on a stage and said to the dancing girls,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.21_0: And they misbehave in a variety of ways.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.22_0: And is it true that those people who previously had faith and confidence have now lost it,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.23_0: that there is no longer any support for the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.24_0: and that the good monks have left and the bad monks are staying on,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.25_0: Please send monks to stay at the monastery in Kīṭāgiri.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.1_0: The monk consented, got up, and left for Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.2_0: When he eventually arrived, he went to the Buddha in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. He bowed to the Buddha, sat down,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.3_0: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks, it is the newly arrived monks of the Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.5_0: “I hope you’re keeping well, monk, I hope you’re comfortable;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.6_0: I hope you’re not tired from traveling.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.7_0: And where have you come from?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.8_0: “We’re keeping well, Venerable Sir, we’re comfortable,”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.10_0: He then told the Buddha all that had happened at Kīṭāgiri,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.11_0: Then I robed up in the morning and, taking my bowl and robe, entered Kīṭāgiri to collect almsfood.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.12_0: A certain lay follower saw me walking for alms in Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.13_0: He approached me, bowed, and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.15_0: ‘It’s not easy to get any alms-food.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.17_0: After preparing me a house, that lay follower said to me,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.19_0: ‘I’ll go to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.20_0: ‘Well then, sir, in my name please bow with your head to the Buddha’s feet and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.21_0: “Venerable Sir, the monastery in Kīṭāgiri has been corrupted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.22_0: Assaji and Punabbasuka are the resident monks there. They are bad and shameless,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.23_0: They were misbehaving in this way:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.25_0: And they misbehave in a variety of ways.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.26_0: And is it true that those people who previously had faith and confidence have now lost it,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.27_0: that there is no longer any support for the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.28_0: and that the good monks have left and the bad monks are staying on,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.29_0: Please send monks to stay at the monastery in Kīṭāgiri.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.1_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.2_0: “Is it true, monks, that the bad and shameless monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are misbehaving like this at Kīṭāgiri?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.3_0: They were misbehaving in this way:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.5_0: And they misbehaved in a variety of ways.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.6_0: And is it true that those people who previously had faith and confidence have now lost it,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.7_0: that there is no longer any support for the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.8_0: and that the good monks have left and the bad monks are staying on?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.11_0: “It’s not suitable, monks, it’s not proper for you to stay.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.12_0: How can those foolish men misbehave like this?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.13_0: Whether or not they flow, and doubles, or they standard up, raise their joined palms to do acts of respect toward them, and do the same.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.14_0: They will carry these things about, crooked, leaning on women, or girls, and begging into houses. They’ll bulbs, creepers, ropes, and cremate them on both sides.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.15_0: They will eat from the same plates as these women and drank from the same vessels. They sat on the same seats as them, and they lay down on the same beds, on the same sheets, under the same covers, both on the same sheets and under the same covers. They ate at the wrong time, drank alcohol, and wore garlands, perfumes, and cosmetics. They’re drink alcohol, sang, played instruments, and performed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.16_0: While the women were dancing, singing, playing instruments, and performing,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.17_0: While the villages are dancing, singing, and instruments, and performing, so would they.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.20_0: They will play around the various games: board games with eight and ten rows, imaginary board games, hopscotch, spillikins, dice games, tip-cat, painting-with-the-hand games, ball games, toy-pipe games, toy-plow games, turning somersaults, toy-windmill games, toy-measure games, toy-carriage games, toy-bow games, letter-guessing games, thought-guessing games, games of mimicking deformities.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.21_0: They’ll train in elephant riding, in horsemanship, in carriage riding, in archery, in swordsmanship.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.22_0: And they ran in front of elephants, horses, and carriages, and they ran backwards and forwards.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.23_0: wither away, they’ll shake, rock, and trembled.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.24_0: They spread their outer robe on a stage and said to the dancing girls,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.27_0: And they will engage in many kinds of misbehavior.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.28_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.30_0: he gave a teaching and addressed Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Moggallāna:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.31_0: “Sāriputta, the two of you should go and do a legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from Kīṭāgiri. They are your students.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.32_0: “Sir, how can we do a procedure of banishing these monks from Kīṭāgiri? They are temperamental and harsh.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.1_0: “And this is how it should be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.2_0: First you should accuse the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka. They should then be reminded of what they have done, before they are charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.3_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.4_0: Now these monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are doing bad and their families.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.5_0: and these bad, unskillful things are seen and heard about.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.6_0: The families corrupted by them have been seen and heard about.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.7_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of banishing them from Kīṭāgiri,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.8_0: They should not spend the whole night at Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.10_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.11_0: Now these monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are doing bad and their families.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.12_0: and these bad, unskillful things are seen and heard about.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.13_0: The families corrupted by them have been seen and heard about.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.14_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of banishing them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.15_0: They should not spend the whole night at Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.16_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of banishing them from Kīṭāgiri should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.17_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.18_0: For the second time I speak on this matter: ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.19_0: A third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.20_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.21_0: Now these monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are doing bad and their families.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.22_0: and these bad, unskillful things are seen and heard about.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.23_0: The families corrupted by them have been seen and heard about.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.24_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of banishing them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.25_0: They should not spend the whole night at Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.26_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of banishing them from Kīṭāgiri should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.27_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.28_0: The Sangha has done the legal procedure of banishing Assaji and Punabbasuka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.29_0: They should not spend the whole night at Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.30_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.0_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.1_0: “When a legal procedure of banishment has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.2_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.3_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.4_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.5_0: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed any offense that is clearable by confession, it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.6_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.7_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.8_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without questioning the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.9_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without the admission of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.10_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.11_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.12_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has confessed their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.13_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.14_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.15_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.16_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.17_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of ejection is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.18.0_0: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.18.1_0: “When a legal procedure of banishment has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.19_0: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done with the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.20_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.21_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.22_0: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.23_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done after having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.24_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.32_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”

ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.35.0_0: The group of fourteen on wishing
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.35.1_0: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.36_0: They are quarrelsome and argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.37_0: he is ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.38_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.39_0: “When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.40_0: “When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.41_0: He has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view; he’s failed in view.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.44_0: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.47_0: his bodily conduct is frivolous; his verbal conduct is frivolous; his bodily and verbal conduct are frivolous.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.50_0: he is improperly behaved by body; he is improperly behaved by speech; he is improperly behaved by body and speech.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.53_0: his bodily conduct is harmful; his verbal conduct is harmful; his bodily and verbal conduct are harmful.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.56_0: he has wrong livelihood by body; he has wrong livelihood by speech; he has wrong livelihood by body and speech.
