ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.1_0: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of banishment done against himself should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.3_0: You shouldn’t give the full ordination
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.4_0: if formal support is not given;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.6_0: He should not consent to an instructor of nuns;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.7_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.8_0: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.9_0: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.10_0: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.11_0: You shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.12_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.13_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.14_0: A nun should not cancel the invitation procedure of a monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.15_0: You shouldn’t make a choice to do
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.16_0: A nun should not make accusations against a monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.17_0: A nun should not ask a monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.18_0: He should not accuse a monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.19_0: A nun should not remind a monk of an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.20_0: He should not associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.21_0: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of banishment are finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.1_0: Soon afterwards a sangha of monks headed by Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Moggallāna went to Kīṭāgiri and did the legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.2_0: They should not spend the whole night at Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.3_0: After the Sangha had done the procedure of banishing them, those monks did not conduct themselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.4_0: nor did they ask the monks for forgiveness. Instead they abused and reviled them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.5_0: and they slandered them as acting from desire, ill will, confusion, and fear.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.6_0: And they left and they disrobed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.8_0: “When the Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing them, how can these monks act like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.9_0: The monks won’t abuse or insult them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.10_0: and they’re acting out of desire, ill will, confusion, and fear.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.13_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.14_0: “Is it true, monks, that when the Sangha had done a procedure of banishing them, the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka didn’t act properly ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.15_0: nor did they ask the monks for forgiveness. Instead they abused and reviled them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.16_0: and they slandered them as acting from desire, ill will, confusion, and fear.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.20_0: “It’s not suitable, monks, it’s not proper for you to stay.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.21_0: How can these foolish men act like this when the Sangha had done a procedure of banishing them?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.22_0: The monks won’t abuse or insult them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.23_0: and they’re acting out of desire, ill will, confusion, and fear.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.25_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.27_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.28_0: “Well then, don’t lift that legal procedure of banishment.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of banishing him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.2_0: They give full ordination to a novice monk who has been given dependence, and who agrees to use a novice monk, and who has been appointed as instructor of nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.3_0: A monk who has these five qualities should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of banishing him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.5_0: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.6_0: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.7_0: A monk who has these five qualities should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.8_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of banishing him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.9_0: he cancels the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation of a regular monk; he accuses him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.10_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of banishing him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.11_0: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.12.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of banishing him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.13_0: They don’t give dependence to formal support, nor do they consent to a novice monk attend on him. They being appointed as instructor of nuns, and if he instructs about the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.14_0: These are the five qualities that should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.15_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of banishing him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.16_0: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.17_0: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.18_0: These are the five qualities that should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.19_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of banishing him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.20_0: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation of a regular monk; he doesn’t make amends for permission; he doesn’t accuse monks; he doesn’t remind about offenses; he doesn’t make a regular monk forgot to preparation:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.21_0: These are the eight qualities that should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.22_0: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.1.1_0: “And, monks, this is how it should be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.1.2_0: After approaching the Sangha, the monk who has had a legal procedure of banishment done against himself should put his upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.1.3_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing me, but I have conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. I ask for the legal procedure of banishment to be lifted.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.1.4_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.1.5_0: And they should ask a third time.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.1.6_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.1_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.2_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing him. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of banishment to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.3_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift the legal procedure of banishing him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.5_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.6_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing him. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of banishment to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.7_0: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of banishment.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.8_0: Any monk who approves of charging him with a banishment against this monk should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.9_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.10_0: For the second time I speak on this matter: ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.11_0: A third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.12_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.13_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing him. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of banishment to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.14_0: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of banishment.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.15_0: Any monk who approves of charging him with a banishment against this monk should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.16_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.17_0: The Sangha has lifted the legal procedure of banishing monk so-and-so.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.18_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.19_0: The second section on the legal procedure of banishment is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Sudhamma was the resident monk at the householder Citta’s monastery at Macchikāsaṇḍa. He was in charge of the building work and received a regular supply of food.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.2_0: When Citta wanted to invite the Sangha, a group of monks, or an individual monk, he would not do so without getting permission from Sudhamma.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.3_0: On one occasion a number of senior monks—Venerable Sāriputta, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, Venerable Mahākaccāna, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhika, Venerable Mahākappina, Venerable Mahācunda, Venerable Anuruddha, Venerable Revata, Venerable Upāli, Venerable Ānanda, Venerable Rāhula—were wandering in Kāsī, when they arrived at Macchikāsaṇḍa.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.4_0: When Citta heard that they had arrived,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.5_0: he went to them, bowed, and sat down.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.6_0: After Sāriputta had instructed, inspired, and gladdened Citta with a teaching,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.8_0: “Sirs, may the senior mendicants please accept my offering of tomorrow’s meal.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.9_0: And they accepted by remaining silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.1_0: When he knew that they had accepted, Citta got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated them with his right side toward them, and went to Sudhamma. He bowed to him
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.3_0: “Venerable, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the senior monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.5_0: “Previously when Citta wanted to invite the Sangha, a group of monks, or an individual monk, he would not do so without getting permission from me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.6_0: But now he has invited the senior monks without my permission.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.7_0: He’s been corrupted, this Citta. He’s uninterested and has no affection for me.” He said to Citta,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.11_0: “Venerable, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the senior monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.14_0: “What difference does it make to me whether Sudhamma accepts or not?” He then bowed down, circumambulated Sudhamma with his right side toward him, and left.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.1_0: The following morning Citta prepared various kinds of fine food for the senior monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.3_0: “Let me go and see what Citta has prepared for the senior monks.” He then robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Citta’s house, where he sat down on a prepared seat.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.4_0: Citta approached Sudhamma, bowed, and sat down.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.6_0: “You have prepared many kinds of fine food.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.7_0: But there’s one that’s missing: sesame cookies.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.8_0: “When there are so many jewels in the word of the Buddha, Sir, you speak of sesame cookies.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.9_0: Formerly there were some traders from the south who went to an eastern country to trade.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.10_0: From there they brought back a hen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.11_0: That hen mated with a crow
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.12_0: and because of that she had a chick.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.13_0: And when that chick wanted to crow like a rooster, it cried, ‘cock-a-doodle-caw.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.14_0: And when that chick wanted to crow like a rooster, it cried, ‘cock-a-doodle-caw.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.15_0: In the same way, when there are so many jewels in the word of the Buddha, you speak of sesame cookies.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.6_0: I’ll do my best to supply you with robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicines.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.8_0: When Sudhamma repeated it a third time,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.12_0: “I’ll go to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.13_0: “Well then, please tell the Buddha of our entire conversation.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.14_0: And I would not be surprised if you returned to Macchikāsaṇḍa.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.1_0: Sudhamma put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robe, and left for Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.2_0: When he eventually arrived, he went to the Buddha in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. He bowed to the Buddha, sat down,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.3_0: and told him about the conversation he had had with Citta.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.5_0: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it should not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.6_0: How can you demean and insult Citta, who has faith and confidence, who is a donor and benefactor, and a supporter of the Sangha?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.7_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.9_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.10_0: “Well then, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.11_0: Citta asked him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.1_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.2_0: First you should accuse the monk Sudhamma. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he is charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.3_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.4_0: How can you demean and insult Citta, who has faith and confidence, who is a donor and benefactor, and a supporter of the Sangha?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.6_0: Citta asked him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.8_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.9_0: How can you demean and insult Citta, who has faith and confidence, who is a donor and benefactor, and a supporter of the Sangha?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.10_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.11_0: Citta asked him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.12_0: Any monk who approves of doing this procedure of reconciliation against him should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.13_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.14_0: For the second time I speak on this matter: ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.15_0: A third time I speak on this matter:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.16_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.17_0: How can you demean and insult Citta, who has faith and confidence, who is a donor and benefactor, and a supporter of the Sangha?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.18_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.19_0: Citta asked him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.20_0: Any monk who approves of doing this procedure of reconciliation against him should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.21_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.22_0: The Sangha has done the legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.23_0: Citta asked him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.24_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.0_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.1_0: “When a legal procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.2_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.3_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.4_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.5_0: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed any offense that is clearable by confession, it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.6_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.7_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.8_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without questioning the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.9_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without the admission of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.10_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.11_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.12_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has confessed their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.13_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.14_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.15_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.16_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.17_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of reconciliation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.18.0_0: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.18.1_0: “When a legal procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.19_0: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done with the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.20_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.21_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.22_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.23_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done after having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.24_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.25_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.26_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done with the admission of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.27_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.28_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.29_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.30_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.31_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.32_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.33_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.34_0: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of reconciliation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.0_0: The group of four on wishing
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.2_0: he is trying to stop householders from acquiring material gain; he is trying to harm householders; he is trying to get householders to lose their place of residence; he abuses and reviles householders; he causes division between householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.3_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.5_0: he disparages the Buddha to householders; he disparages the Teaching to householders; he disparages the Sangha to householders; he demeans and insults householders; he doesn’t fulfill legitimate promises to householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.6_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.7_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against five kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.8_0: those who are trying to stop householders from acquiring material gain; those who are trying to harm householders; those who are trying to get householders to lose their place of residence; those who abuse and revile householders; those who cause division between householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.9_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against these five kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.10_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against another five kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.11_0: those who disparage the Buddha to householders; those who disparage the Teaching to householders; those who disparage the Sangha to householders; those who demean and insult householders; those who don’t fulfill legitimate promises to householders.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.12_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against these five kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.13_0: The group of four on wishing is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.1_0: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of reconciliation done against himself should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.3_0: You shouldn’t give the full ordination
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.4_0: if formal support is not given;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.6_0: He should not consent to an instructor of nuns;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.7_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.8_0: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.9_0: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.10_0: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.11_0: You shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.12_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.13_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.14_0: A nun should not cancel the invitation procedure of a monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.15_0: You shouldn’t make a choice to do
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.16_0: A nun should not make accusations against a monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.17_0: A nun should not ask a monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.18_0: He should not accuse a monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.19_0: A nun should not remind a monk of an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.20_0: He should not associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.21_0: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of reconciliation are finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.1.1_0: Soon afterwards the Sangha did a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.1.2_0: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.1.3_0: He went to Macchikāsaṇḍa, but feeling humiliated, he was unable to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.1.5_0: When other monks asked him why,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.1.6_0: if he had asked Citta for forgiveness,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.1.7_0: and he told them what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.1.8_0: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.1_0: “Well then, the Sangha should give a companion messenger to Sudhamma
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.3_0: And this is how the messenger should be given.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.4_0: First you should ask a monk, and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.5_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.6_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.8_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.9_0: The Sangha gives monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.10_0: Any monk who approves of giving monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.11_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.12_0: The Sangha has given monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.13_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.1_0: “Sudhamma should now go to Macchikāsaṇḍa with that monk as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness, saying,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.2_0: ‘Please forgive me, householder; I wish to reconcile with you.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.3_0: If he does, it is good.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.4_0: If not, then the Sangha should be appointed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.5_0: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder; he wishes to reconcile with you.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.6_0: If he does, it is good.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.7_0: If not, then the Sangha should be appointed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.8_0: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder; I wish to reconcile with you.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.9_0: If he does, it is good.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.10_0: If not, then the Sangha should be appointed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.11_0: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder; I ask in the name of the Sangha.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.12_0: If he does, it is good.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.13_0: If not, then within sight and hearing of Citta, the monk Sudhamma should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and confess that offense.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.1.1_0: Soon afterwards Sudhamma went to Macchikāsaṇḍa with a monk as a companion messenger, and he asked Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.1.2_0: And he conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. He then went to the monks
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.1.4_0: So what should I do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.1.5_0: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.1.6_0: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of reconciliation against Sudhamma.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.2_0: They give full ordination to a novice monk who has been given dependence, and who agrees to use a novice monk, and who has been appointed as instructor of nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.3_0: These are the five qualities that a monk who has no reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.5_0: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.6_0: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.7_0: These are the five qualities that a monk who has no reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.8_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.9_0: he cancels the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation of a regular monk; he accuses him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.10_0: The monk who has these eight qualities should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.11_0: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.12.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.13_0: They don’t give dependence to formal support, nor do they consent to a novice monk attend on him. They being appointed as instructor of nuns, and if he instructs about the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.14_0: These are the five qualities that should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.15_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.16_0: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.17_0: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.18_0: These are the five qualities that should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.19_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.20_0: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation of a regular monk; he doesn’t make amends for permission; he doesn’t accuse monks; he doesn’t remind about offenses; he doesn’t make a regular monk forgot to preparation:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.21_0: These are the eight qualities that should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.22_0: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.1_0: “And, monks, this is how it should be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.2_0: The monk Sudhamma should approach the Sangha, put his upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.3_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against me, but I have conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. I ask for the legal procedure of reconciliation to be lifted.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.4_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.5_0: And they should ask a third time.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.6_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.7_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.8_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against him. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of reconciliation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.9_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift the legal procedure of reconciliation against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.11_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.12_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against him. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of reconciliation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.13_0: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of reconciliation against him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.14_0: Any monk who approves of giving him that procedure of reconciliation should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.15_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.16_0: For the second time I speak on this matter: ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.17_0: A third time I speak on this matter:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.18_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.19_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against him. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of reconciliation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.20_0: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of reconciliation against him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.21_0: Any monk who approves of giving him that procedure of reconciliation should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.22_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.23_0: The Sangha has lifted the legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.24_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.25_0: The fourth section on the legal procedure of reconciliation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.0_0: The legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has been done against one who has committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.2_0: At that time Venerable Channa had committed an offense, but refused to recognize it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.4_0: “How can Venerable Channa commit an offense, but then refuse to recognize it?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.6_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that Channa is acting like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.10_0: “It’s not suitable, monks, it’s not proper for you to stay.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.11_0: How can Channa commit an offense, but then refuse to recognize it?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.14_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.15_0: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.16_0: The Sangha has prohibited him from interacting with the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.1_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.2_0: First you should accuse the monk Channa. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he is charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.3_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.4_0: The monk Channa didn’t want to recognize it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.6_0: The Sangha has prohibited him from interacting with the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.8_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.9_0: The monk Channa didn’t want to recognize it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.10_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.11_0: The Sangha has prohibited him from interacting with the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.12_0: Any monk who approves of doing this procedure
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.14_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.15_0: For the second time I speak on this matter: ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.16_0: A third time I speak on this matter:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.17_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.18_0: The monk Channa didn’t want to recognize it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.19_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.20_0: The Sangha has prohibited him from interacting with the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.21_0: Any monk who approves of doing this procedure
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.23_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.24_0: The Sangha has done the legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.25_0: The Sangha has prohibited him from interacting with the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.26_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.28_0: that the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.29_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.0_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.1_0: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.2_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.3_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.4_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.5_0: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed any offense that is clearable by confession, it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.6_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.7_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.8_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without questioning the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.9_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without the admission of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.10_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.11_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.12_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has confessed their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.13_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.14_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.15_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.16_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.17_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.18.0_0: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.18.1_0: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.19_0: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done with the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.20_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.21_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.22_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.23_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done after having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.24_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.25_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.26_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done with the admission of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.27_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.28_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.29_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.30_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.1_0: “And, monks, this is how it should be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.2_0: The monk Channa should approach the Sangha, put his upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.3_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting me for not recognizing an offense, but I have conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. I ask for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.4_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.5_0: And they should ask a third time.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.7_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.8_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.9_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift the legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.13_0: The Sangha lifts his legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense.”

ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.0_0: The legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense against one who has committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.2_0: At this time Venerable Channa had committed an offense, but refused to make amends for it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.4_0: “How can Venerable Channa commit an offense, but then refuse to make amends for it?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.6_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that Channa is acting like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.10_0: “It’s not suitable, monks, it’s not proper for you to stay.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.11_0: How can Channa commit an offense, but then refuse to make amends for it?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.14_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.15_0: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.16_0: The Sangha has prohibited him from interacting with the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.17_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.18_0: First you should accuse the monk Channa. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he is charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.19_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.20_0: but he doesn’t want to make amends for it.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.22_0: The Sangha has prohibited him from interacting with the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.24_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.25_0: but he doesn’t want to make amends for it.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.196_0: The monk Channa should approach the Sangha, put his upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.197_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting me for not making amends for an offense, but I have conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. I ask for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.198_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.199_0: And they should ask a third time.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.207_0: The Sangha lifts his legal procedure against the monk Channa.”

ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.0_0: The legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.2_0: At that time a mendicant called Ariṭtha, who had previously been a vulture trapper, had the following harmful misconception:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.3_0: “As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstructive are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.4_0: A number of monks heard that Ariṭṭha had that view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.5_0: “As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstructive are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.7_0: They went to him and asked,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.9_0: ‘As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstructive are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them’?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.10_0: “Absolutely, reverends. As I understand the Buddha’s teachings, the acts that he says are obstructions are not really obstructions for the one who performs them.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.3_0: for it’s not good to misrepresent him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.4_0: The Buddha would never say such a thing.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.5_0: The Buddha has given many discourses about the obstructive things being obstructive
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.6_0: and how they obstruct one who indulges in them?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.7_0: The Buddha has said that there is little enjoyment in worldly pleasures, but much suffering and much trouble, and that the danger in them is greater.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.8_0: With the simile of a skeleton ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.9_0: similar to a piece of meat ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.15_0: a butcher’s knife and chopping block ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.17_0: and similar to a snake’s head; they are much suffering and much trouble, and the danger in them is greater.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.18_0: But even though the monks corrected Ariṭṭha in this way, he stubbornly held on to that bad and erroneous view, and continued to insist on it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.19_0: “Absolutely, reverends. As I understand the Buddha’s teachings, the acts that he says are obstructions are not really obstructions for the one who performs them.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.1_0: And since they were not able to make him give up that view, they approached the Buddha and told him what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.2_0: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the monks gathered and questioned Ariṭṭha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.3_0: “Is it true, Ariṭṭha, that you have such a view?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.4_0: ‘As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstructive are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them’?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.6_0: “Silly man, who on earth have you ever known me to teach in that way?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.7_0: Haven’t I given many discourses about the obstructive things being obstructive
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.8_0: and how they obstruct one who indulges in them?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.9_0: I’ve said that sensual pleasures give little gratification and much suffering and distress, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.10_0: I have said that worldly pleasures are similar to a skeleton ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.11_0: similar to a piece of meat ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.17_0: a butcher’s knife and chopping block ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.19_0: similar to a snake’s head; they are much suffering and much trouble, and the danger in them is greater.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.20_0: But still you misrepresent me by your wrong grasp, harm yourself, and make much bad karma.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.21_0: This will be for your lasting harm and suffering.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.22_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.24_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:

ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.26_0: The Sangha has prohibited him from interacting with the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.1_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.2_0: First you should accuse the monk Ariṭṭha. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he is charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.3_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.6_0: and he did not give up that view.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.8_0: The Sangha has prohibited him from interacting with the Sangha.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.25_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of ejecting Ariṭṭha for not giving up a bad view,

ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.0_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.1_0: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.2_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.3_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.4_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.5_0: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed any offense that is clearable by confession, it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.6_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.7_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.8_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without questioning the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.9_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without the admission of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.18.1_0: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.19_0: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done with the admission of the accused.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.23_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done after having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.24_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.35.0_0: The group of six on wishing
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.35.1_0: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.36_0: They are quarrelsome and argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.37_0: he is ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.38_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.39_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.40_0: “When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.41_0: He has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view; he’s failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.42_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.43_0: “When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.44_0: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.45_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.46_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view against three kinds of monks:

ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.49_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.57_0: The group of six on wishing in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.58.1_0: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view done against himself should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.60_0: You shouldn’t give the full ordination
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.61_0: if formal support is not given;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.63_0: He should not consent to an instructor of nuns;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.64_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.65_0: He should not commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.66_0: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.67_0: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.68_0: You shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.1_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.70_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.71_0: A nun should not cancel the invitation procedure of a monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.72_0: You shouldn’t make a choice to do
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.73_0: A nun should not make accusations against a monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.74_0: A nun should not ask a monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.75_0: He should not accuse a monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.76_0: A nun should not remind a monk of an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.77_0: He should not associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.78_0: The forty-three kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view are finished.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.1.7_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that the monk Ariṭṭha disrobed after the Sangha had done a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view?”

ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.1.15_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.1.16_0: “Well then, the Sangha should lift that legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.2.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.2.2_0: They give full ordination to a novice monk who has been given dependence, and who agrees to use a novice monk, and who has been appointed as instructor of nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.2.3_0: A monk who has these five qualities should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.2.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.2.5_0: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.2.6_0: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.2.7_0: A monk who has these five qualities should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.2.9_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.2.10_0: he cancels the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation of a regular monk; he accuses him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.2.11_0: A monk who has these eight qualities should not be lifted:

ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.2.23_0: A monk who has these eight qualities should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:34.2.24_0: The group of forty-three on to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:35.1.1_0: “And, monks, this is how it should be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:35.1.2_0: The monk who has been ejected by the Sangha for not giving up a bad view should approach the Sangha, put his upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:35.1.3_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting me for not giving up a bad view, but I have conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. I ask for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.’
